channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MaskCon: Masked Contrastive Learning for Coarse-Labelled Dataset
item.description: More specifically, within the contrastive learning framework, for each sample our method generates soft-labels with the aid of coarse labels against other samples and another augmented view of the sample in question.

item.title: Causal Reasoning in the Presence of Latent Confounders via Neural ADMG Learning
item.description: In this work, we further extend the existing body of work and develop a novel gradient-based approach to learning an ADMG with non-linear functional relations from observational data.

item.title: MI-SegNet: Mutual Information-Based US Segmentation for Unseen Domain Generalization
item.description: We validate the generalizability of the proposed domain-independent segmentation approach on several datasets with varying parameters and machines.

item.title: EasyDGL: Encode, Train and Interpret for Continuous-time Dynamic Graph Learning
item.description: Dynamic graphs arise in various real-world applications, and it is often welcomed to model the dynamics directly in continuous time domain for its flexibility.

item.title: Revisiting DeepFool: generalization and improvement
item.description: Our proposed attacks are also suitable for evaluating the robustness of large models and can be used to perform adversarial training (AT) to achieve state-of-the-art robustness to minimal l2 adversarial perturbations.

item.title: Open-source Frame Semantic Parsing
item.description: While the state-of-the-art for frame semantic parsing has progressed dramatically in recent years, it is still difficult for end-users to apply state-of-the-art models in practice.

item.title: Wasserstein Auto-encoded MDPs: Formal Verification of Efficiently Distilled RL Policies with Many-sided Guarantees
item.description: Our approach yields bisimulation guarantees while learning the distilled policy, allowing concrete optimization of the abstraction and representation model quality.

item.title: MEDIMP: Medical Images and Prompts for renal transplant representation learning
item.description: Our goal is to learn meaningful manifolds of renal transplant DCE MRI, interesting for the prognosis of the transplant or patient status (2, 3, and 4 years after the transplant), fully exploiting the available multi-modal data in the most efficient way.

item.title: Split-Et-Impera: A Framework for the Design of Distributed Deep Learning Applications
item.description: Many recent pattern recognition applications rely on complex distributed architectures in which sensing and computational nodes interact together through a communication network.

item.title: Dense Distinct Query for End-to-End Object Detection
item.description: Concretely, we first lay dense queries like traditional detectors and then select distinct ones for one-to-one assignments.

item.title: ExBEHRT: Extended Transformer for Electronic Health Records to Predict Disease Subtypes & Progressions
item.description: In this study, we introduce ExBEHRT, an extended version of BEHRT (BERT applied to electronic health records), and apply different algorithms to interpret its results.

item.title: Pixel-wise Agricultural Image Time Series Classification: Comparisons and a Deformable Prototype-based Approach
item.description: Improvements in Earth observation by satellites allow for imagery of ever higher temporal and spatial resolution.

item.title: SHERF: Generalizable Human NeRF from a Single Image
item.description: To this end, we propose a bank of 3D-aware hierarchical features, including global, point-level, and pixel-aligned features, to facilitate informative encoding.

item.title: BiCro: Noisy Correspondence Rectification for Multi-modality Data via Bi-directional Cross-modal Similarity Consistency
item.description: As one of the most fundamental techniques in multimodal learning, cross-modal matching aims to project various sensory modalities into a shared feature space.

item.title: Cross-Modal Implicit Relation Reasoning and Aligning for Text-to-Image Person Retrieval
item.description: To alleviate these issues, we present IRRA: a cross-modal Implicit Relation Reasoning and Aligning framework that learns relations between local visual-textual tokens and enhances global image-text matching without requiring additional prior supervision.

item.title: CiCo: Domain-Aware Sign Language Retrieval via Cross-Lingual Contrastive Learning
item.description: Our framework, termed as domain-aware sign language retrieval via Cross-lingual Contrastive learning or CiCo for short, outperforms the pioneering method by large margins on various datasets, e. g., +22. 4 T2V and +28. 0 V2T R@1 improvements on How2Sign dataset, and +13. 7 T2V and +17. 1 V2T R@1 improvements on PHOENIX-2014T dataset.

item.title: Tube-Link: A Flexible Cross Tube Baseline for Universal Video Segmentation
item.description: Our framework is a near-online approach that takes a short subclip as input and outputs the corresponding spatial-temporal tube masks.

item.title: Edge Deep Learning Model Protection via Neuron Authorization
item.description: With the development of deep learning processors and accelerators, deep learning models have been widely deployed on edge devices as part of the Internet of Things.

item.title: LSTM-based Video Quality Prediction Accounting for Temporal Distortions in Videoconferencing Calls
item.description: Using these features together with VMAF core features, our proposed model achieves a PCC of 0. 99 on the validation set.

item.title: A multi-functional simulation platform for on-demand ride service operations
item.description: In addition, the existing simulators still face many challenges, ranging from their closeness to real environments of ride-sourcing systems, to the completeness of different tasks they can implement.

item.title: Balanced Spherical Grid for Egocentric View Synthesis
item.description: However, the na\"ive spherical grid suffers from irregularities at two poles, and also cannot represent unbounded scenes.

item.title: Conformal Prediction for Time Series with Modern Hopfield Networks
item.description: To quantify uncertainty, conformal prediction methods are gaining continuously more interest and have already been successfully applied to various domains.

item.title: Evaluating Transformer Models and Human Behaviors on Chinese Character Naming
item.description: These results suggested that the transformer models can well capture human's character naming behavior.

item.title: Re-thinking Federated Active Learning based on Inter-class Diversity
item.description: In this work, we first demonstrate that the superiority of two selector models depends on the global and local inter-class diversity.

item.title: Unbiased Multiple Instance Learning for Weakly Supervised Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: At each MIL training iteration, we use the current detector to divide the samples into two groups with different context biases: the most confident abnormal/normal snippets and the rest ambiguous ones.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Video Representation Learning with Unaligned Text for Sequential Videos
item.description: Sequential video understanding, as an emerging video understanding task, has driven lots of researchers' attention because of its goal-oriented nature.

item.title: Encoding Binary Concepts in the Latent Space of Generative Models for Enhancing Data Representation
item.description: We propose a novel binarized regularization to facilitate learning of binary concepts to improve the quality of data generation in autoencoders.

item.title: Spherical Transformer for LiDAR-based 3D Recognition
item.description: In this work, we study the varying-sparsity distribution of LiDAR points and present SphereFormer to directly aggregate information from dense close points to the sparse distant ones.

item.title: XWikiGen: Cross-lingual Summarization for Encyclopedic Text Generation in Low Resource Languages
item.description: But, for low-resource languages, the scarcity of reference articles makes monolingual summarization ineffective in solving this problem.

item.title: Reveal to Revise: An Explainable AI Life Cycle for Iterative Bias Correction of Deep Models
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose Reveal to Revise (R2R), a framework entailing the entire eXplainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) life cycle, enabling practitioners to iteratively identify, mitigate, and (re-)evaluate spurious model behavior with a minimal amount of human interaction.

item.title: The Complexity of Why-Provenance for Datalog Queries
item.description: Towards this end, we pinpoint the data complexity of why-provenance for Datalog queries and key subclasses thereof.

item.title: Are uGLAD? Time will tell!
item.description: Segmentation of multivariate time series data is a technique for identifying meaningful patterns or changes in the time series that can signal a shift in the system's behavior.

item.title: A Tale of Two Circuits: Grokking as Competition of Sparse and Dense Subnetworks
item.description: Grokking is a phenomenon where a model trained on an algorithmic task first overfits but, then, after a large amount of additional training, undergoes a phase transition to generalize perfectly.

item.title: Bayesian Optimization for Function Compositions with Applications to Dynamic Pricing
item.description: Bayesian Optimization (BO) is used to find the global optima of black box functions.

item.title: Emotionally Enhanced Talking Face Generation
item.description: Our proposed framework is equipped with a user-friendly web interface with a real-time experience for talking face generation with emotions.

item.title: Transcriptomics-based matching of drugs to diseases with deep learning
item.description: In this work we present a deep learning approach to conduct hypothesis-free, transcriptomics-based matching of drugs for diseases.

item.title: DG-Trans: Dual-level Graph Transformer for Spatiotemporal Incident Impact Prediction on Traffic Networks
item.description: Therefore, DG-Trans is equipped with dual abilities that extract spatiotemporal dependency and identify anomaly nodes affected by incidents while removing noise introduced by benign nodes.

item.title: Learning Context-aware Classifier for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation is still a challenging task for parsing diverse contexts in different scenes, thus the fixed classifier might not be able to well address varying feature distributions during testing.

item.title: Learning Optical Flow and Scene Flow with Bidirectional Camera-LiDAR Fusion
item.description: To fuse dense image features and sparse point features, we propose a learnable operator named bidirectional camera-LiDAR fusion module (Bi-CLFM).

item.title: Fix the Noise: Disentangling Source Feature for Controllable Domain Translation
item.description: This allows our method to smoothly control the degree to which it preserves source features while generating images from an entirely new domain using only a single model.

item.title: Dynamically Expandable Graph Convolution for Streaming Recommendation
item.description: Personalized recommender systems have been widely studied and deployed to reduce information overload and satisfy users' diverse needs.

item.title: Neural networks trained on synthetically generated crystals can extract structural information from ICSD powder X-ray diffractograms
item.description: However, training directly on simulated diffractograms from databases such as the ICSD is challenging due to its limited size, class-inhomogeneity, and bias toward certain structure types.

item.title: Debiased Contrastive Learning for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: This solution is designed to tackle the popularity bias issue in recommendation systems.

item.title: The Treasure Beneath Multiple Annotations: An Uncertainty-aware Edge Detector
item.description: Deep learning-based edge detectors heavily rely on pixel-wise labels which are often provided by multiple annotators.

item.title: Contrastive Alignment of Vision to Language Through Parameter-Efficient Transfer Learning
item.description: We find that a minimal set of parameter updates ($<$7%) can achieve the same performance as full-model training, and updating specific components ($<$1% of parameters) can match 75% of full-model training.

item.title: Dynamic Healthcare Embeddings for Improving Patient Care
item.description: Here, we propose DECENT, an auto-encoding heterogeneous co-evolving dynamic neural network, for learning heterogeneous dynamic embeddings of patients, doctors, rooms, and medications from diverse data streams.

item.title: Diffusion-Based 3D Human Pose Estimation with Multi-Hypothesis Aggregation
item.description: On the other hand, JPMA is proposed to assemble multiple hypotheses generated by D3DP into a single 3D pose for practical use.

item.title: SpikeCV: Open a Continuous Computer Vision Era
item.description: SpikeCV focuses on encapsulation for spike data, standardization for dataset interfaces, modularization for vision tasks, and real-time applications for challenging scenes.

item.title: STDLens: Model Hijacking-resilient Federated Learning for Object Detection
item.description: Based on the insights, we introduce a three-tier forensic framework to identify and expel Trojaned gradients and reclaim the performance over the course of FL.

item.title: Monocular Visual-Inertial Depth Estimation
item.description: We evaluate on the TartanAir and VOID datasets, observing up to 30% reduction in inverse RMSE with dense scale alignment relative to performing just global alignment alone.
